conference: Conference on Computer and Communications Security
notes: A good proportion of papers are available for download from the conference website, but not all. Also, many artifacts are available there. Authors were allowed to submit past reviews and responses. After responses, 17 papers were 'revived'. The chairs PC found (statistically) that authors submitting more than 4 papers were less likely to be accepted (see https://acmccs.github.io). They also computed the distribution of number of co-authors, with a mode of 4 for accepted papers. Only 1 single-author paper was accepted (of 34 submitted). They also computed the distrubtion of papers represented, with most papers coming from a single country (up to 4). American authors submitted 540 papers with 114 accepted, for example, while Chinese authors submitted 132 papers with 12 accepted.
pc_members: Ehab Al-Shaer (University of North Carolina Charlotte)

Andrew Miller (University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign)
Kehuan Zhang (Chinese University of Hong Kong)
